author: La Razón Online
title: Gobierno de Tlaxcala invita a partir la rosca en la Villa Navideña
text: Siguen festejos navideños en Tlaxcala Gobierno de Tlaxcala invita a partir la rosca en la Villa Navideña Celebra el Gobierno de Tlaxcala el corte de la Rosca Monumental en la "Villa Navideña 2023", con actividades gratuitas y sorpresas para la ciudadanía El Gobierno del Estado, a través del Patronato para las Exposiciones y Ferias en la Ciudad de Tlaxcala, invita a la ciudadanía tlaxcalteca a participar en el tradicional corte de la Rosca Monumental, este 29 de diciembre a las 21:00 horas en las instalaciones del Domo Grande de la “Villa Navideña Tlaxcala, 2023”. La presidenta ejecutiva del Patronato para las Exposiciones y Ferias en la Ciudad de Tlaxcala, Rosa Elena Nava García Méndez, comentó que la rosca monumental se compartirá con 2 mil 500 personas, quienes también disfrutarán de gratas sorpresas. La Rosca, que medirá unos 77 metros, es de la pastelería Tutti Bocado. Además, los pequeños podrán dejar sus cartas a los Reyes Magos en el recinto ferial. Agregó que en este último día de actividades de la “Villa Navideña Tlaxcala, 2023” los asistentes disfrutarán por última vez de las funciones gratuitas del show internacional de patinaje “La magia del hielo”, en el que participan más de 20 acróbatas representando fragmentos de obras clásicas como el “Rey León”, “Cats”, y “El Fantasma de la Ópera”, entre otros. Además, los asistentes al último día de actividades disfrutarán de 15:00 a 16:00 horas de los juegos mecánicos que serán gratuitos para todos los niños. El recinto ferial abre sus puertas a partir de las 15:00 horas y la entrada general es de 10 pesos; las y los niños de menos de 1.10 metros de estatura, así como adultos mayores que presenten su credencial del Inapam, entran gratis. Esto es lo que hay detrás del video viral](/virales/paso-torre-eiffel-esto-hay-detras-video-viral-562196) - [Las polémicas FOTOS filtradas de Millos 999](/entretenimiento/son-fotos-filtradas-millos-999-561101) - [¿Dónde se repartirán enseres y canastas básicas en Acapulco y Coyuca el 22 de enero?](/estados/repartiran-enseres-canastas-basicas-acapulco-coyuca-22-enero-561908) - [Exatlón México: ¿Quién gana el Duelo de los Enigmas hoy 23 de enero 2024?](/entretenimiento/exatlon-mexico-gana-duelo-enigmas-hoy-23-enero-2024-562164)

author: @nzherald
title: Waikato fires: Crews respond to 115 vegetation fires in 8 weeks
text:
There were more than 100 vegetation fires in Waikato across eight weeks, Fire and Emergency New Zealand have revealed.
The data, provided at the request of the Waikato Herald this week, showed Fire and Emergency crews responded to 115 fires between January 1 and February 26.
The news comes as Fire and Emergency reported an increase in the number of wildfires across the country.
“The frequency of wildfires is increasing in New Zealand and here 99% of wildfires are caused by people,” a Fire and Emergency spokesman said.
Crews battled strong winds and steep terrain for days to fight a fire at Kūaotunu, Coromandel, in January.

author: Emily Sachar, Editor
title: Deportation Proceedings Against Honduran Immigrant Temporarily Stayed, After Dozens of Supporters Journey Hours to Federal Courthouse
text:
|
A federal judge in U.S. District Court in Manhattan extended her July 21 temporary restraining order protecting Gerson Turcios, a 23-year-old Honduran immigrant and Rhinebeck resident detained Friday by the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, from deportation.
The decision by Judge Ronnie Abrams will keep Turcios in federal custody at the Orange County Jail in Goshen for another week, allowing him and his legal team time to begin to try to reopen his immigration case, which his attorneys hope will allow him to remain in the country.
According to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Turcios unlawfully entered the United States through Texas in December 2019 and was issued a notice to appear in immigration court. He was ultimately ordered removed from the country on Nov. 3, 2023.
The decision Wednesday was met with relief from the more than 30 friends, family members, and local employers who took the trip from Rhinebeck to Manhattan for the hearing to support Turcios’ case. Turcios did not attend the hearing.
“It’s a total win,” said Luciano Valdivia, owner of Market St Restaurant and Board President of the Rhinebeck Area Chamber of Commerce, speaking outside the courthouse to a crowd of supporters. Valdivia has helped lead the organizing effort around Turcios’s case. “This is what was hoped for,” he said. Many community members at the courthouse said the hearing’s outcome is a testament to the power of collective action and local support.
Turcios was detained by ICE agents outside his home in Rhinebeck around 5 p.m. last Friday, according to a family member who witnessed the incident but has asked to remain anonymous. ICE reportedly came looking for someone else, but as Turcios returned home from work and pulled into the driveway, two agents approached his car, used a facial recognition device to confirm his identity, and then placed him in handcuffs.
The arrest galvanized the Rhinebeck community. The next day, neighbors organized to find legal representation and to raise money for Turcios’s defense. A SpotFund campaign launched on Sunday has raised more than $65,000, as of Wednesday night. As news of Wednesday’s hearing date spread, organizers quickly arranged a bus seating roughly 50 people to bring community members to the courthouse.
Just after sunrise, seven supporters boarded that coach bus in the parking lot of Tops Friendly Market in Rhinebeck, bound for the federal courthouse in Lower Manhattan. Other supporters opted to take the train or drive to the city on their own. The bus group—made up of Turcios’s family, employers, and neighbors, along with community members eager to help—traveled together for the two-hour ride. They clustered near the front of the bus, many of them strangers before the ride commenced.
At the center of the group sat Idania Williams, who describes Turcios as “like a brother” to her, though they are not related. As the bus drove south, Williams shared stories about Turcios’s life. Since he arrived in Rhinebeck in December 2019, he’s celebrated Christmases and birthdays with her family, she said, and he passed his driver’s test with their help. “He was part of our family,” she said.
The mood on the bus was nervous in anticipation but warm, filled with laughter, quiet resolve, and a sense of shared purpose. For many, the trip felt like a small act of resistance, an antidote to the feeling of helplessness that has spread in some circles as a result of the federal government’s immigration crackdown. “I’ve been seeing the spread of terror in immigrant communities in the Hudson Valley,” said Ashwini Sukthankar, a labor organizer from Rhinecliff who rode the bus to the courthouse. “We just have to show up.”
Others echoed that sense of urgency. Isaac Hoey-Wasow, who attended Rhinebeck High School with Turcios but didn’t know him personally, said he had heard only good things from mutual friends—about Turcios’s work ethic, his dream of starting a landscaping business, and his desire to build a life in the United States after he left Honduras and walked alone for days to reach the Texas border. “I would be here no matter who it was because it’s for each other,” he said. “And if you’re able to step up to help someone who’s been treated unjustly, it’s the right thing to do.”
Kathryn Noelle Phillips, one of Turcios’s landscaping clients, said she grew concerned when he didn’t show up for work last Saturday. He has been helping her reseed the grass on her property after septic work and is always punctual, she said. “It wasn’t like him,” she said as she rode the bus. Turcios had worked for her for over a year, helping with everything from mowing the lawn and cleaning gutters to fixing her shower. She also noted his deep ecological knowledge and love of nature. Phillips found out about his arrest later that day, from a story in The Daily Catch.
Many who traveled to the courthouse said that while they had followed the ICE raids and deportation cases across the country with growing alarm, Turcios’s detention brought the issue home and compelled them to act. “When it’s in your backyard, that gives you a better opportunity to do something that hopefully affects the situation you’re seeing,” said Jess Lurie, a Democratic political organizer, on her way to the hearing.
In the courtroom, just after 11 a.m., Abrams acknowledged the emotional weight of the case and the outpouring of support from the community. “I fully appreciate how heartbreaking this must be for Turcios and his family,” Abrams said from the bench. She acknowledged the many letters submitted on Turcios’s behalf and said it was clear he is “loved in his community.”
But she also made clear the legal limitations of her role. “The law is clear,” she said. Federal law restricts the district court from staying the removal order.
During the hearing, Abrams asked why a motion to reopen the case had not already been filed, given that the original removal order was issued over 18 months ago. Gregory Copeland, one of Turcios’s attorneys, explained that the team had only just been granted access to their client hours earlier and had not yet had time to review the details and history of his case.
Immigration attorney Paul Grotas has since been retained to file a motion to reopen Turcios’s case with the Board of Immigration Appeals. According to Valdivia, Grotas met with Turcios via Zoom on Wednesday.
For many in the room, the judge’s decision was a moment of cautious optimism. “It’s a short-term victory,” said Jenny Friedberg, who employed Turcios as a landscaper and has helped organize the support and fundraising effort for his case. Friedberg said she was relieved to know Turcios won’t be moved, that he can have visitors and make phone calls. “We have time,” she added.
Some close friends and family members were disappointed not to see Turcios in person at the courthouse, as they had expected. “It’s kind of dehumanizing for him not to be here,” a close friend, Brendan Dougherty, said outside the courthouse after the hearing. Turcios had been planning to attend Dougherty’s birthday party on Saturday, the day after he was detained.
Even so, Dougherty said he’s been struck by the rapid and widespread response to the case. Local community members from both sides of the aisle have come together around the case, asking ‘Why him?’ Dougherty said.
On the bus ride home, U.S. Rep. Pat Ryan (D-18) called Leah Conklin, another organizer, to express his gratitude to the group and praise the local effort as a potential model for other communities confronting similar situations.
“We’re just gonna keep doing our work,” said Friedberg, who underscored the importance of continued community support and action. “I’m very energized.”

author: Nadia Cruz
title: Amlitros: Venden litro de pulque servido en botella con la forma de AMLO
text: El presidente Andrés Manuel López Obrador (AMLO) ha sido la inspiración para crear peluches, camisas y esta vez llegó a la bebida de los dioses, el [Pulque. ](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/mexico/amlo-responde-a-quema-de-pinata-de-trabajadores-del-poder-judicial-de-la-federacion-no-importa-no-es-con-ellos/) Y es que, como se ha viralizado en redes sociales, un cilindro fue creado con la forma del mandatario mexicano para llenarlo de un litro de pulque, naciendo así el “Amlitro”. Esta nueva prueba del ‘ingenio mexicano’ nació entre simpatizantes de AMLO, cuyo emprendimiento está siendo todo un éxito ¿Te animas a probarlo? Se vende en esta pulquería de México. ¿Eres fan de AMLO? Prueba el litro de pulque que apoya a la Cuarta Transformación La bebida de los dioses, mejor conocida como pulque, ya se vende en un cilindro con la forma del “Tlatoani” para mostrar su apoyo hacía AMLO y la Cuarta Transformación. El “Amlitro” fue una idea que surgió entre los dueños de la pulquería Calavera Coyote, ubicada en el centro de Puebla, cerca de la Facultad de Filosofía y Letras de la Benemérita Universidad Autónoma de Puebla (BUAP). Para el antojo, y sólo por el mes de abril, podrás comprar tu “Amlitro” por el módico precio de: - Amlitro de Pulque Natural: 95 pesos - Amlitro de Pulque Curado: 135 pesos Tu bebida será servida directamente de un jarrón de pulque en un cilindro con la forma de AMLO, posteriormente será sellado con su tapa y se agrega un popote para tu comodidad. Redes sociales reaccionan al Amlitro que se vende en Puebla Las reacciones en redes sociales por el “Amlitro” no se hicieron esperar, generando buenos comentarios, memes y hasta criticas. Aunque algunos criticaron que era una bebida desagradable al igual que la forma del cilindro, la gran mayoría celebró su creación y afirmaron que “necesitan uno de manera urgente”. “Es un honor estar con Obrador y Claudia” y “¿Donde venden ese termo? necesito uno” fueron algunos de los comentarios. También los usuarios aprovecharon la publicación para presumir sus pertenencias con la forma de AMLO.

author: Diario de Ávila
title: Sanidad lleva a lo privado 4.350 ecografías
text: Sanidad Sanidad lleva a lo privado 4.350 ecografías B.M - jueves, 19 de junio de 2025 El contrato tiene un presupuesto de 208.800 euros y las pruebas se harán desde agosto Hospital Nuestra Señora de Sonsoles - Foto: David Castro La Gerencia de Asistencia Sanitaria de Ávila contratará por 208.800 euros la realización de 4.350 ecografías en un proceso que supone externalizar estas pruebas y hacerlas fuera del sistema público. En este caso, la plataforma de contratación del sector público dio a conocer este contrato para la realización de estos procedimientos diagnósticos mediante ultrasonidos para pacientes beneficiarios de la asistencia sanitaria pública pero que se harán en centros privados. Según se indica en el contrato, el plazo de ejecución será de cuatro meses y se comenzarán a realizar desde el próximo 1 de agosto o desde la fecha de formalización del contrato si es posterior.Según se indica en el procedimiento que se acaba de abrir, se llevará a cabo la realización de procedimientos diagnósticos mediante ultrasonidos que no pueden ser realizados pro medios propios, como consecuencia de la falta de profesionales para cubrir la plantilla actual del centro, unido al crecimiento de la demanda que no ha podido ser absorbido con el incremento de la actividad. Por ello se lleva a cabo esta contratación y así posibilitar la reducción de los tiempos de espera de los pacientes de la Gerencia Sanitaria de Ávila que se encuentran pendientes de este tipo de pruebas.Aunque no se conoce cuántos pacientes están a la espera de hacerse una ecografía a día de hoy, puesto que se informa de estos datos de forma trimestral, la última información disponible, correspondiente al cierre del pasado mes de marzo, indicaba que en Ávila había 481 personas en la lista de espera para hacerse esta prueba con una media de espera de 41 días.Hay que tener en cuenta que no se trata solo de las personas que están en lista en un momento determinado sino que es una prueba a la que se siguen incorporando pacientes ya que es un método diagnóstico.El número estimado de procedimientos que se van a realizar asciende a 4.350. De ellos, las cifras previstas son de 400 en piel y tejidos blandos, 1.200 en articulaciones, 250 en cuello (tiroides), 1.300 en abdomen completo, 800 en riñón, vías urinarias y próstata, 200 en cuello (troncos supraaórticos) y 200 en el sistema venoso de las extremidades inferiores.El adjudicatario de este contrato está obligado a cumplir todo el plazo de vigencia del mismo y a que sus centros dispongan de los recursos y equipamiento general para realizar con eficacia, calidad y garantía las actividades que se contratan, así como el personal sanitario y no sanitario que permita la perfecta atención y realización de las pruebas.contrato anterior. No es la primera vez que desde la sanidad abulense se decide hacer una contratación externa para realizar ecografías como uno de los métodos para bajar la lista de espera.La última de estas contrataciones se vivió en septiembre del pasado año cuando se decidió externalizar 3.600 ecografías ante el aumento de demanda de esta prueba. Entonces el contrato tuvo un presupuesto de casi 270.000 euros, un plazo de ejecución de dos meses y el adjudicatario fue el hospital Santa Teresa.Las ecografías que se contrataron en aquel momento eran parecidas a las de la actualidad puesto que se repiten algunas como piel y tejidos blandos, articulaciones, cuello o riñón, aunque también había algunas diferentes como cadera pediátrica.Ya en aquel momento se explicó que la cifra que se iba a contratar se hacía en base a una previsión en cuanto al número de pruebas y se recordó que dentro del plan de choque de reducción de listas de espera, tanto quirúrgicas como de pruebas diagnósticas, se contemplaba el autoconcierto (peonadas) y el concierto, acudir a centros privados, que es lo que se hizo en entonces y se vuelve a realizar con el nuevo contrato.Se decidió optar por este sistema tras ver que la demanda de ecografías en el área de salud de Ávila se había venido incrementando de forma sostenida desde 2019 hasta alcanzar niveles superiores a los previos a la pandemia. Sigue el canal de Diario de Ávila en WhatsApp y entérate de todo lo que ocurre , , , , ,

author: @Arab_News
title: Israel strikes near Syria's capital: state media - Arab News
text:
DAMASCUS: Syrian state media reported Israeli attacks near the capital Damascus on Thursday.
“Our air defense are intercepting hostile targets in the vicinity of Damascus,” official news agency SANA said.
“An Israeli attack targeted the vicinity of the capital Damascus,” state television said.
Israel rarely comments on individual strikes targeting Syria, but it has repeatedly said it will not allow arch-foe Iran, which backs President Bashar Assad’s government, to expand its presence there.
Israel has launched hundreds of air strikes on its northern neighbor since Syria’s civil war began in 2011, primarily targeting Iran-backed forces including Lebanese Hezbollah fighters as well as Syrian army positions.
But it has intensified attacks since the war between Israel and Hamas began on October 7, as tensions rise across the Middle East.
Damascus international airport has been out of service since Israeli strikes targeted it in late November, just hours after flights resumed following similar attacks the previous month.
Israel strikes near Syria's capital: state media
https://arab.news/4da3d
Israel strikes near Syria's capital: state media
DAMASCUS: Syrian state media reported Israeli attacks near the capital Damascus on Thursday.

author: , The Daily News Journal
title: Taylor Swift concert cancellations: Vienna among notable cancellations
text: How many Taylor Swift concerts have been canceled? Vienna shows join list of notable cancellations All of [ Taylor Swift's "Eras Tour" shows in Vienna, Austria were cancelled ](https://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2024/08/07/taylor-swift-cancels-vienna-shows-terrorist-attack/74472897007/)on Wednesday after government officials confirmed a planned terrorist attack. The "Cruel Summer" singer was scheduled to perform at Ernst Happel Stadium on Thursday, Aug. 8, Friday, Aug. 9 and Saturday Aug. 10. According to a translated [social media post](https://x.com/karlnehammer/status/1821293658697503166) by Austria's Chancellor, Karl Nehammer, the planned attack was "very serious," however the threat was able to be recognized early and prevented. "The cancellation of the Taylor Swift concerts by the organizers is a bitter disappointment for all fans in Austria," he added. The Vienna cancellations mark the first time "Eras Tour" shows have been cancelled due to security threats. Other dates have been postponed due to weather. Barracuda Music, the promoter for the Austrian shows, said all tickets will be automatically refunded within the next 10 business days. As [previously reported by the USA TODAY Network](https://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2024/08/07/taylor-swift-cancels-vienna-shows-terrorist-attack/74472897007/), around 65,000 people were expected to attend each night as well as up to 15,000 people outside the stadium without tickets, which fed security concerns. What Taylor Swift shows were cancelled? The following shows were cancelled in Vienna, Austria: - Thursday, Aug. 8 ay Ernst-Happel Stadium - Friday, Aug. 9 ay Ernst-Happel Stadium - Saturday, Aug. 10 ay Ernst-Happel Stadium Where is Taylor Swift scheduled to perform next? On Thursday, Aug. 15, Swift will kick off a [ 5-night stint at London's Wembley Stadium](https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2024/08/08/taylor-swift-london-shows-not-affected-by-cancellations-police-say/74472961007/), before headed off to Canada. British Police don't believe the planned attack in Vienna will affect her London shows. "There is nothing to indicate that the matters being investigated by the Austrian authorities will have an impact on upcoming events here in London," a spokesperson for London's Metropolitan Police (the Met) said. Other Taylor Swift concert cancellations: Eras Tour In Buenos Aires, Swift [pushed back her Oct. 10 show](https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2023/11/10/taylor-swift-reschedules-fridays-buenos-aires-concert-over-weather/71534061007/) to Oct. 12 after heavy rain fell on the Argentinian capital."I love a rain show but I’m never going to endanger my fans or my fellow performers and crew," she wrote on X, formerly Twitter.A week later in Rio de Janeiro, she moved her Nov. 18 concert to Nov. 20 because of sweltering temperatures, [one day after a fan died](https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2023/11/18/taylor-swift-fan-dies-at-eras-tour-brazil/71633669007/) at her show. Lover Fest After postponing the show because of the Covid-19 pandemic, Swift [canceled Lover Fest tour](https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2021/02/27/taylor-swift-cancels-lover-fest-world-tour-after-postponing/6852089002/) with four shows, two in Los Angeles and two in Boston. Melbourne Cup horse racing event In 2019, she canceled a concert at the Melbourne Cup horse racing event. Her tour promoter, Mushroom Events, said “changes to her Asian prof schedule have made it logistically impossible” for her to be at the cup. This was amid [criticism from animal rights groups](https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/celebrities/2019/09/21/taylor-swift-cancels-melbourne-cup-concert-amid-animal-rights-protests/2401378001/) accusing her of “endorsing animal abuse” by performing at the Australian event. Red Tour She canceled a sold-out concert on May 24, 2014 in Bangkok, Thailand, which came under military rule after a coup d'etat. She said, “I’m so sad about the concert being canceled… sending my love to the fans in Thailand.” Speak Now She cancelled four shows in Louisville, Ky., Atlanta, Ga., and Charlotte, N.C., because of bronchitis. She rescheduled the July shows for October and November. Follow Taylor Swift reporter Bryan West on [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@bryanwesttv) and [X as @BryanWestTV](https://twitter.com/bryanwesttv). Diana Leyva covers trending news and service journalism for The Tennessean. Contact her at [Dleyva@gannett.com](mailto:Dleyva@gannett.com) or follow her on X, the platform formerly known as Twitter, at [@_leyvadiana](https://x.com/_leyvadiana)
